alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 1:20PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Volusia County through 145 PM EDT... At 115 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm producing a waterspout over the nearshore Atlantic waters about one mile southeast of Ponce Inlet, near New Smyrna Beach, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Orange, New Smyrna Beach, South Daytona, Daytona Beach Shores and Ponce Inlet. WATERSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
